- So, we wanna start by

and some of the challenges
that we heard from customers
when it comes to managing their resources,

and their Route 53 settings
across their organization,
their VPCs.
Today, customers use a variety
of different options and resources.
This includes their private hosted zones,

this includes their DNS
firewall rules and rule groups,
and also there resolver rules

that they use for forwarding
of queries across their VPCs.

But the management of
all of these resources,

what we have been
hearing from customers is

there's a lot of complexity
and cost associated
with managing them and enforcing them
consistently across their VPCs.

So as you are creating them in
one of the VPCs or accounts,
having them consistently enforced

in specific organizational
accounts, or specific accounts,

and sharing them consistently
becomes a bottleneck
when it comes to a lot of the management.
And then the third thing was,

a lot of the administrators
also wanted to have

central control and visibility
of all of these resources,

and to see if there are any
gaps in how they are enforced

across specific accounts, or
their entire organization.
And so on April 22nd of this year,
we introduced Route 53 profiles,
which is a new feature on Route 53

that you can use to manage
your Route 53 resources
across your entire organization.

With profiles, you can create
a single configuration,
which we call a profile,
and then you can use that to share
or associate across multiple VPCs.
You can do that directly across your VPCs,
or you can use Resource Access Manager

as a way to share them
across your AWS accounts,
organizational units in your organization,

or your entire AWS
organization as a whole.

With profiles, we see that
customers can create compliance,
so as you are adding more rules,

or you're adding more
configurations or resources,
you can get that central visibility
to ensure that all your accounts

have the same set of
resources and settings,
ensuring that there are no gaps
in the configuration and the management.

And then profiles also reduces
a lot of the management

and complexity that comes
with a large organization.
So, as you're sharing profiles,
and all the resources within a profile,
across your accounts,

any new addition of
resources to your profiles

that you're sharing automatically
gets deployed downstream
without you having to manage

individual configurations
and sharing and associations.

And so that reduces a lot of
the operational burden for you

as you have a large
set of VPCs or accounts

that you want to manage
configurations for.

some of the use cases
that we hear from customers.

The pricing that we

is on a per region basis.
And we have a base tier,

a charge of $0.75,

that goes up to 100
Profile-VPC associations
